snippet: Bryan Norcross’s criticism of the National Hurricane Center and of New York City’s mayor for briefly playing down Hurricane Sandy’s severity raised some debate.
abstract: Weather Channel meteorologist Bryan Norcross has provoked debate following his criticism of the National Hurricane Center and New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg for playing down the severity of Hurricane Sandy; says that while the current system is good at prediction, its ability to issue warnings is hindered by bureaucracy.
lead_paragraph: Bryan Norcross’s criticism of the National Hurricane Center and of New York City’s mayor for briefly playing down Hurricane Sandy’s severity raised some debate.
